Text: hmmm.. my first IMDB link..  http://www.imdb.com/title/tt2384811/

Brutal, tense and darkly comic... brace yourself for new TV thriller Utopia

Five members of an online forum agree to meet after gaining possession of the original manuscript for fabled graphic novel The Utopia Experiments. Unbeknown to them, a shadowy organisation known as the Network is in pursuit of the comic book and its agents are prepared to kill to secure the prize. 

1x01 -- 

Five online strangers end up being drawn together by the legendary manuscript of a cult graphic novel and they end up being pursued by a secret and deadly organisation known only as The Network. The online comic book forum agree to meet after gaining possession of the original manuscript for the cult graphic novel 'The Utopia Experiments'. Ahree of the forum members meet in the pub while another ends up being confronted and killed by two Network henchmen. The only witness to the murder is 11-year-old Grant and after he flees with the manuscript, the henchmen attempt to catch him.

Nathan Stewart-Jarrett....... as Jarrett
Alexandra Roach............... as Becky
Wilson Adeel Akhtar.......... as Wilson
Paul Higgins...................... as Dugdale
Stephen Rea..................... as Letts
Alistair Petrie.................... as Geoff
Fiona O'Shaughnessy......... as Jessica Hyde
Neil Maskell....................... as Arby
Brilliant show...so far it has a great plot that is really dark and horrific. If I still acid, this would be one of those shows I'd watch while tripping.

The torrent is absolutely fine, but I totally disagree with dragonFyr and micron66. I can normally force myself to at least wath a full episode of a new shows premire, but I barely made it thru 1/2 of this one before deciding to delete this from my hard drive. This is NOT worth downloading and NOT worth watching. I'd rather go to the dentist and have a root canal than have to sit thru any more of this show.
@ Justracy- the first half of this was a bit aimless but you seriously missed out by not watching the rest. Top show, definitely worth watching
Wow, I love this show already.  Refreshingly original, visually intriguing, quirky, and compelling.  Not for the Honey Boo Boo crowd.
